thread.title: Russia grants AOC to new regional carrier
thread.title_full: Russia grants AOC to new regional carrier | Finance & Data content from ATWOnline

author: Polina Montag-Girmes
title: Russia grants AOC to new regional carrier
text:
Russian aviation authorities have granted an air operator’s certificate (AOC) to regional carrier YuVT-Aero, which will be based in two cities in the Tatarstan republic—Kazan and Bugulma. Its name in Russian decrypts as Yugo Vostok Tatarstana or South-East of Tatarstan.
The carrier’s fleet will reportedly consist of Bombardier CRJ200LRs. The airline will specialize on regional flights in Volga region. According to Russian legislation, it will be able to get permission for operating international flights after two years of flying domestic routes.
Two local airlines in Tatarstan lost their AOCs in less than two years—Kazan-based Tatarstan Airlines, which had its AOC withdrawn at the end of 2013 after a fatal crash of a Tatarstan Boeing 737-500 at Kazan Airport, and Bugulma-based Ak Bars Aero airline, which lost its AOC in May after failing to relaunch flights after a winter temporary suspension caused by a decline in passenger numbers.
